roleset.name: create, accomplishing
roleset.note: PRODUCE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'produce' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with 'make'; adjectival 'productive' based on BOLT-4,5. (from produce.01-v)
PRODUCTION-N NOTES: Roleset based on produce.01. Verbnet class performance-26.7. Framed by Katie. (from production.01-n)
PRODUCING-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry produce.01. (from producing.01-n)

example.name: produce-v: straight transitive
example.text: The plant will produce control devices used in motor vehicles and household appliances.
example.arg: control devices used in motor vehicles and household appliances.

example.name: produce-v: passivized
example.text: The test and Learning Materials are both produced by the same company, Macmillan/McGraw-Hill.

example.name: produce-v: with benefactive
example.text: A contractor will produce vital equipment for the Army and Navy.

example.name: production-n: Example with a beneficiary
example.text: The production of vaccines for the CDC

example.name: production-n: Example with a source
example.text: The plant's production of nuclear energy from uranium

example.name: producing-n: straight transitive
example.text: Khan is also known for his producing of films, such as, Phir Bhi Dil Hai Hindustani , Asoka, and Chalte Chalte.

roleset.name: bring to light, show
roleset.note: PRODUCE-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from produce.02-v)

example.name: produce-v: Oh, those silly Birthers.
example.text: But [Barack Obama]-1 has yet *-1 to produce a valid birth certificate and is no president of the United States .

roleset.name: producing much
roleset.note: PRODUCTIVE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. (from productive.01-j)

example.name: productive-j
example.text: You would be more productive canvassing for Russ Feingold .
